intro: Heracleum sphondylium subsp. trifoliolatum, commonly known as the three-lobed cow parsley, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbrella-like clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often found in temperate regions. The subspecies is distinguished by its three-lobed leaves, which set it apart from other members of the species.
